verses.name: Proverbs 27:11
verses.text: My son, be wise, and make my heart glad, that I may answer him that reproacheth me.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:12
verses.text: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself; but the simple pass on, and are punished.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:13
verses.text: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger, and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:14
verses.text: He that blesseth his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning, it shall be counted a curse to him.

verses.name: Proverbs 27:15
verses.text: A continual dropping in a very rainy day and a contentious woman are alike.
